events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a single male speaker discussing the nature of karma, describing it as potentially physical or verbal, but originating in thought. He explains that the quality of the thought determines the quality of the sanskar and the karm, classifying them as "good, bad, neutral, devotional." He notes that intensity matters and various actions can be judged as 'good' to varying degrees, and that all actions are impressed or recorded in the mind. Describing the mind as having levels of subtlety, he explains that because the medium in which the karma is being recorded is so subtle, the mind can record an infinite amount of information, since every soul is eternal with unlimited past karma, all recorded in our minds - this he calls 'sanchit karma'.
